abstract: Alexis Pinturault of France wins two straight World Cup giant slalom races in Hinterstoder, Austria; other winter sports news noted.
lead_paragraph: Alexis Pinturault dominated the men’s World Cup giant slalom in Hinterstoder, Austria, becoming the first skier from France since Jean Noel Auger in 1969 to win two straight races in the discipline.

headline.main: Alexis Pinturault Wins World Cup Slalom

snippet: Alexis Pinturault dominated the men’s World Cup giant slalom in Hinterstoder, Austria, becoming the first skier from France since Jean Noel Auger in 1969 to win two straight races in the discipline....
